channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The next wave of AI won’t be driven by LLMs. Here’s what investors should focus on instead
item.description: The diminishing returns from each new iteration of LLMs are making it clear that we’re nearing the top of the S-curve for this particular technology.

item.title: Germany’s auto giants are struggling to stay relevant
item.description: Germany's automotive sector, long recognized for producing high-quality cars, is struggling to preserve its relevance in the age of electrification.

item.title: Podcast: These are the people affecting markets — and your money
Benjamin Netanyahu hails ‘the start of the day after Hamas’ after leader Yahya Sinwar is killed
item.description: Israeli forces in Gaza killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, a chief architect of last year’s attack on Israel that sparked the war, the military said.

item.title: Netflix shares jump 5% in premarket after third-quarter earnings beat
item.description: Netflix saw momentum in its ad-supported membership tier, which jumped 35% quarter-over-quarter.

item.title: China reports better-than-expected retail sales and industrial production data
item.description: The data comes after a flurry of recent announcements from authorities as Beijing seeks to boost consumption and support its flagging real estate sect...

item.title: Nvidia’s stock sets one record — but falls short of another
Chinese equities jump as central bank rolls out support for the stock market
China needs stimulus with 'beautiful deleveraging' to avoid debt crisis, says Ray Dalio
item.description: China must employ a “beautiful deleveraging” in addition to its recent stimulus measures in order to avoid debt crisis, says Ray Dalio.

item.title: Meet the Gen Z author and economic commentator who coined the term ‘vibecession’
Netflix CFO sees up to 13% revenue growth in 2025, totaling up to $44 billion
Learning to love nuclear power
item.description: AI and carbon emissions are driving a change of heart.

item.title: Organic chicken producer’s collapse leaves Midwest farmers struggling to feed their flocks
item.description: Pure Prairie Poultry shuttered its Charles City, Iowa, plant after filing for bankruptcy last month.

item.title: There’s one ‘tremendous’ mistake people make while negotiating, top negotiator says
item.description: The "egocentric bias" is at the heart of it.

item.title: After rejecting Google takeover, Wiz says it will IPO 'when the stars align'
item.description: Wiz is hoping to achieve $1 billion in annual recurring revenue in 2025 — a key condition the company wants to meet before going public.
